channel.title: Like Audacity (Mac), but better UI?
channel.description:
Audacity has been my go-to app for quick sample/waveform edits for ages.
Even so, the UI/UX is actually pretty crappy, with no mouse side-scrolling support and no keyboard modifier to trigger the Zoom tool. It makes moving around a real pain.
So, is there anything simple, like Audacity, but that has a modern UI/UX?
Don't mind spending a little money.

item.title: Like Audacity (Mac), but better UI?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Just want a quick n dirty way to edit sample waveforms, like quickly grabbing a sentence from an acapella, or a single snare.

I want to be in and out in the time it takes Live to launch.

If I’m doing a session of chopping up clean beats, then chances are I’ll use Live for the auto transient detection. (Makes me kinda wish I’d kept my Push 2.)
